Sentencas: Ce1-xErxO2 and Ce1-2xErxGdxO2 co-doped ceria electrolyte nanopowder materials were successfully prepared by sol-gel method.
Titulo: Thermal characterization of Er-doped and Er-Gd co-doped ceria-based electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: Depending on the temperature, the crystal structure changes were analyzed by X-ray diffraction.
Titulo: Thermal characterization of Er-doped and Er-Gd co-doped ceria-based electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: It was observed that the crystal size of the electrolytes decreased depending on the temperature and the time.
Titulo: Thermal characterization of Er-doped and Er-Gd co-doped ceria-based electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction results confirmed cubic fluorite structure in the samples.
Titulo: Thermal characterization of Er-doped and Er-Gd co-doped ceria-based electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: The microstructural properties of the samples were analyzed by scanning electron microscopy, and thermal stability measurement was performed by thermogravimetric and differential thermal analyses.
Titulo: Thermal characterization of Er-doped and Er-Gd co-doped ceria-based electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: The total electrical conductivity of the nanopowder electrolytes was determined by the dc four-point probe technique in air at temperatures ranging from room temperature to 1373 K.
Titulo: Thermal characterization of Er-doped and Er-Gd co-doped ceria-based electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: The four-probe conductivity results revealed that Ce0.8Er0.1Gd0.1O2 has a higher ionic conductivity compared to Ce0.83Er0.17O2 at 1123 K.
Titulo: Thermal characterization of Er-doped and Er-Gd co-doped ceria-based electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: The four-probe conductivity results show that both Ce1-xErxO2 and Ce1-2xErxGdxO2 solid electrolytes have potential application to oxide ionic conductor for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Thermal characterization of Er-doped and Er-Gd co-doped ceria-based electrolyte materials for SOFC
